column4: does the ubuntu live CD have a minimum free HD space requirement?
my current partitioning is rubbish, the w2k setup barely works
but ubuntu doesn't seem to want to actually boot in order to let me repartition
i bleive 2GB
eeeek!
on the C: partition?
cos if so, I'm in trouble.  There's only 1/2 Gb on C:, and it's all full
there is no C: partition in ubuntu ... heh
ok, I mean *free* disk space
I mean ubuntu to take all of it when done, but it's not booting up to the bit where I can get to repartition the drive
for resizing windows?
I want to wipe windows
oh just delete windows then
as my win setup is totally messed up anyway
do I have to delete windows before booting the liveCD?
nope -- in the livecd installer, just choose Delete All Data

ok - that's what I thought.  I'll try again, but the LiveCD wouldn't boot up last time - just got to screen with mouse pointer and creamy background and stayed there for 15 minutes with no feedback :-(
try safe mode graphics?
ok - will that let me install too?
min is 192MB
aha.  For the LiveCD or for ubuntu in general?
ubuntu
ah... I thought it could run on a low memory system?
look at the live cd requirements
